intro: Cremaspora talbotii, commonly known as the talbot's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. Cremaspora talbotii is adapted to arid environments and often grows in rocky or sandy soils.
